meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: Varsity Team's Point Guard Isn't Short For His Age, He's In 5th Grade

div.div: The wild contrast of the 11-year-old point guard Julian Newman’s stature on the court with his varsity teammates has brought global attention.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VnfRHp&via=Digg&text=Varsity Team's Point Guard Isn't Short For His Age, He's In 5th Grade

div.a: Guerrilla Surveillance Camera Destruction Hits The U.S.

div.div: It started in Germany with masked anarchists dismantling CCTV cameras, now Camover is a global game.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VZG6AU&via=Digg&text=Guerrilla Surveillance Camera Destruction Hits The U.S.

div.a: Weather Satellites Could Miss The Next Hurricane Sandy

div.div: Our ability to predict approaching storm fronts relies on weather satellites orbiting the earth several times a day, and the US Government Accountability Office is warning that we might lose a few of those orbits.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12U4mvJ&via=Digg&text=Weather Satellites Could Miss The Next Hurricane Sandy

div.a: Inside The Witness Protection Program

div.div: Ever imagined what it would be like to be someone else for a day? How about for the rest of your life? That's the reality for the thousands who have entered the federal witness protection program since it started in 1971.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WztPFr&via=Digg&text=Inside The Witness Protection Program

div.a: Watch The Fireball That Streaked Across San Francisco Last Night

div.div: It wasn't nearly as dramatic as the fireball that exploded over Russia yesterday, but last night the San Francisco Bay Area saw its own light show last night when a meteor streaked across the night sky.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VrEp4A&via=Digg&text=Watch The Fireball That Streaked Across San Francisco Last Night

div.a: North Korea Reportedly Preparing For More Nuclear Tests

div.div: North Korea has told its key ally, China, that it is prepared to stage one or even two more nuclear tests this year in an effort to force the United States into diplomatic talks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VVrw2R&via=Digg&text=North Korea Reportedly Preparing For More Nuclear Tests

div.div: BECAUSE SHE WANTS TO LIVE A LONG LIFE

div.a: This 102-Year-Old Woman Just Quit Smoking

div.div: Birthday girl Clara Cowell has shown it’s never too late to change your lifestyle - after giving up smoking two weeks ago aged 102.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XNyFjT&via=Digg&text=This 102-Year-Old Woman Just Quit Smoking

div.a: Georgia To Execute Mentally Ill Inmate Despite Doctors' Recanted Testimony

div.div: Every doctor who has ever evaluated Warren Lee Hill since 1991, when he was given his first comprehensive evaluation, has concluded that he is mentally retarded. Despite this, Hill remains just days away from being put to death by lethal injection.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XLvKrT&via=Digg&text=Georgia To Execute Mentally Ill Inmate Despite Doctors' Recanted Testimony

div.a: The Strangest Unsolved Mystery Of The Last Century

div.div: Crazy cosmic phenomena are nothing new in the Ural range: 54 years ago this month, the northern part of the Urals played host to one of the most fascinating unsolved mysteries in the modern age.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VZeOKW&via=Digg&text=The Strangest Unsolved Mystery Of The Last Century

div.div: NON-CREEPY SIDE HAS YET TO EMERGE

div.a: Creepy Side Of Search Emerges On Facebook

div.div: There haven’t been any documented cases of Graph Search being used to prey on children, but some people got concerned after seeing contrived example searches of, for example, “women under 18 years old who live nearby and are not in a relationship.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YwhZdE&via=Digg&text=Creepy Side Of Search Emerges On Facebook

div.a: Rare Full-Color WWII Photos

div.div: Alfred T Palmer, a photographer for the US Office of War Information, captured a societal sea change 35 mm at a time—these are some of his most captivating portraits.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z5cZ1A&via=Digg&text=Rare Full-Color WWII Photos

div.a: Russian Fireball Won't Be Last Surprise Asteroid Attack

div.div: The world will have to live with surprise asteroid attacks on the scale of Friday's Russian fireball, at least for a while.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YmSr3z&via=Digg&text=Russian Fireball Won't Be Last Surprise Asteroid Attack

div.a: What Are The Conspiracy Theorists Saying About The Russian Meteor?

div.div: Nationalist leader Vladimir Zhirinovsky told reporters in Moscow it could have been "war-mongers" in the United States. "It's not meteors falling. It's a new weapon being tested by the Americans."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12TTHkx&via=Digg&text=What Are The Conspiracy Theorists Saying About The Russian Meteor?

div.div: SANTORUM COMING OUT WITH A NEW VEST LINE

div.a: The GOP Primary: Where Are They Now?

div.div: It's a year later, and last year's Republican primary is a faded memory. How did everyone do?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZghFpn&via=Digg&text=The GOP Primary: Where Are They Now?

div.a: Has The Transparent Smartphone Finally Arrived?

div.div: A new prototype revives Hollywood dreams of a translucent future.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XTGlz1&via=Digg&text=Has The Transparent Smartphone Finally Arrived?

div.a: Putin On The Couch

div.div: Why the strongman's neuroses are weakening Russia from the inside out.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W00lyq&via=Digg&text=Putin On The Couch

div.a: Cops Allowed To Work 'Half Drunk'

div.div: Officers in some Chicago suburbs are even permitted to patrol while legally drunk.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XOZNio&via=Digg&text=Cops Allowed To Work 'Half Drunk'

div.a: Your Internet Might Not Be As Fast As You Think

div.div: Some Internet providers, notably AT&T, are still not delivering the speeds they advertise to consumers, according to a new report by the Federal Communications Commission.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12qMvwi&via=Digg&text=Your Internet Might Not Be As Fast As You Think

div.a: The Quirky World Of Competitive Snow Carving

div.div: Teams of three from Finland, Japan, Germany, Canada, and the U.S. were selected from more than 40 applicants for the inaugural Carve Tahoe, a five-day competition to hew works of art from 14-foot-high, 20-ton blocks of snow.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YxmZyp&via=Digg&text=The Quirky World Of Competitive Snow Carving

div.a: The Worst Lies That Mainstream Nutrition Has Told You

div.div: A lot of the science is now showing that many commonly held beliefs about what a healthy diet should look like are utterly wrong.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14VfmHD&via=Digg&text=The Worst Lies That Mainstream Nutrition Has Told You

div.div: NOT AS HORNY AS WE THOUGHT

div.a: Did Vikings Wear Horned Helmets?

div.div: Why do cartoon Vikings, Scandinavian football fans and Economist covers persist in giving their helmets horns?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UnIHIz&via=Digg&text=Did Vikings Wear Horned Helmets?

div.div: WHEN IN DOUBT, THROW WATER ON IT

div.a: 18 Bad Guys Who Were Way Too Easy To Defeat

div.div: Some bad guys are just way too easy to defeat. You can kill them with water, or yodeling, or just pop their heads off like a Pez dispenser. Here are 18 bad guys who were crushed so easily that it was just plain disappointing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XclszL&via=Digg&text=18 Bad Guys Who Were Way Too Easy To Defeat

div.a: The Worst Cities For College-Educated Women

div.div: Are you a young, college-educated woman? Are you looking to settle down one day with a young, college-educated man? A word of advice: Stay away from Sarasota, Florida.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WuhZMT&via=Digg&text=The Worst Cities For College-Educated Women

div.a: Russians Meme Chelyabinsk

div.div: The city of Chelyabinsk is the butt of many jokes in Russia for its very “hardcore” gentlemen, the sort of jokes Dubliners make about dudes from Cork.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XDiiTc&via=Digg&text=Russians Meme Chelyabinsk

div.a: Inside The Burned-Out Cabin Of Fugitive Ex-Cop Christopher Dorner

div.div: Authorities say fugitive former cop Christopher Dorner died of a single gunshot wound to the head as authorities were pumping tear gas into a mountain cabin during a deadly gun battle with sheriff's deputies.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XFda0Q&via=Digg&text=Inside The Burned-Out Cabin Of Fugitive Ex-Cop Christopher Dorner

div.a: A Very Serious Retrospective Of Vintage Versace Ads

div.div: This post is about nothing more than getting nostalgic for the 90s and those ridiculous but unforgettable Versace ads.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YkmlWf&via=Digg&text=A Very Serious Retrospective Of Vintage Versace Ads

div.a: The Tweet Hereafter Memorializes Famous Last Tweets

div.div: Some collected final tweets are mundane, but others, like Aurora shooting victim Jessica Redfield’s, are unintentionally chilling.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YkXvpj&via=Digg&text=The Tweet Hereafter Memorializes Famous Last Tweets
